Icon Fonts

The Unicorn Design has defined some glyphs in a custom icon font (browse the set). The set is managed with the IcoMoon App.

 icomoon-first  icomoon-last  icomoon-play  icomoon-fullscreen-exit  icomoon-fullscreen  icomoon-iconmonstr-magnifier-6-icon  icomoon-iconmonstr-magnifier-7-icon  icomoon-document  icomoon-documents  icomoon-reload-CW  icomoon-reload-CCW  icomoon-list  icomoon-article  icomoon-book-alt2  icomoon-document-alt-stroke  icomoon-zoom-in  icomoon-zoom-out  icomoon-triangle  icomoon-triangle-2  icomoon-grid  icomoon-grid-view  icomoon-scroll  icomoon-twitter  icomoon-pinterest  icomoon-facebook  icomoon-bookmark  icomoon-upload  icomoon-download  icomoon-email  icomoon-feed  icomoon-info-circle  icomoon-locked  icomoon-document-2

This glyph set can be extended as necessary.

Adding an icon to a link

There are several ways to use the icon glyphs. The core defines a Sass module that manages all the details of using one of the glyphs: 

    .endnotelink{
      @include link-icon(";");
      margin-right: 1em;
      padding:.5em;
    }

Or, you can add the class supplied by IcoMoon: 

<a class="endnotelink icomoon-download" href="...">Export EndNote</a>

Without using the Sass module and/or extending the element's classes, you'd have to duplicate the full CSS with every element: 

    .endnotelink {
        content: "; ";
        font-family: 'icomoon';
        font-style: normal;
        speak: none;
        font-weight: normal;
        line-height: 1;
        -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;
        margin-right: 2px;
        color: #666;
        display: inline-block;
        font-size: 110%;
    }
